a-work-of-art-is-abo-eugene-ionesco.author: Eugene Ionesco
a-work-of-art-is-abo-eugene-ionesco.text: A work of art is above all an adventure of the mind.

accustom-yourself-co-saint-teresa-of-avi.author: Saint Teresa of Avila
accustom-yourself-co-saint-teresa-of-avi.text: Accustom yourself continually to make many acts of love, for they enkindle and melt the soul.

art-is-a-collaborati-andre-gide.author: Andre Gide
art-is-a-collaborati-andre-gide.text: Art is a collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.

before-anything-else-alexander-graham-be.author: Alexander Graham Bell
before-anything-else-alexander-graham-be.text: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.

destiny-a-tyrants-ambrose-bierce.author: Ambrose Bierce
destiny-a-tyrants-ambrose-bierce.text: Destiny: A tyrant's authority for crime and a fool's excuse for failure.

every-man-dies-not-william-wallace.author: William Wallace
every-man-dies-not-william-wallace.text: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.

in-every-mans-heart-christopher-morley.author: Christopher Morley
in-every-mans-heart-christopher-morley.text: In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.

it-is-not-how-old-yo-jules-renard.author: Jules Renard
it-is-not-how-old-yo-jules-renard.text: It is not how old you are, but how you are old.

it-is-the-addition-o-walter-hagen.author: Walter Hagen
it-is-the-addition-o-walter-hagen.text: It is the addition of strangeness to beauty that constitutes the romantic character in art.

loved-you-cant-use-ken-kesey.author: Ken Kesey
loved-you-cant-use-ken-kesey.text: Loved. You can't use it in the past tense. Death does not stop that love at all.

music-is-moonlight-i-jean-paul.author: Jean Paul
music-is-moonlight-i-jean-paul.text: Music is moonlight in the gloomy night of life.

never-have-more-chil-erma-bombeck.author: Erma Bombeck
never-have-more-chil-erma-bombeck.text: Never have more children than you have car windows.

never-wear-anything-p-j-o-rourke.author: P. J. O'Rourke
never-wear-anything-p-j-o-rourke.text: Never wear anything that panics the cat.

our-entire-life-co-jean-anouilh.author: Jean Anouilh
our-entire-life-co-jean-anouilh.text: Our entire life - consists ultimately in accepting ourselves as we are.

people-dont-notice-anton-chekhov.author: Anton Chekhov
people-dont-notice-anton-chekhov.text: People don't notice whether it's winter or summer when they're happy.

return-to-your-frien-william-wallace.author: William Wallace
return-to-your-frien-william-wallace.text: Return to your friends and tell them that we came here with no peaceful intent, but ready for battle, and determined to avenge our own wrongs and set our country free. Let your masters come and attack us: we are ready to meet them beard to beard.

there-is-nothing-so-pythagoras.author: Pythagoras
there-is-nothing-so-pythagoras.text: There is nothing so easy but that it becomes difficult when you do it reluctantly.

were-all-just-passi-john-hurt.author: John Hurt
were-all-just-passi-john-hurt.text: We're all just passing time and occupy our chair very briefly.

what-makes-the-deser-antoine-de-saint-ex.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
what-makes-the-deser-antoine-de-saint-ex.text: What makes the desert beautiful is that somewhere it hides a well.
